String.Source: Interesting. I would like to see this transformation take place.
String.Dest: 真有意思。我很想看看这种变化到底是怎样发生的。

String.Source: Interesting. I would like to see this transformation take place.
String.Dest: 真有意思。我很想看看这种变化到底是怎样发生的。

String.Source: Interesting. I would like to see this transformation take place.
String.Dest: 真有意思。我很想看看这种变化到底是怎样发生的。

String.Source: Tell me what you know about the ritual.
String.Dest: 告诉我你对这个仪式的了解。

String.Source: Tell me what you know about the ritual.
String.Dest: 告诉我你对这个仪式的了解。

String.Source: With these books burned, we need another source of information.
String.Dest: 这些书被烧了，我们需要其他的信息来源。

String.Source: With these books burned, we need another source of information.
String.Dest: 这些书被烧了，我们需要其他的信息来源。

String.Source: Wolves are fierce creatures. Can you fight?
String.Dest: 狼是很凶悍的动物。你能对付吗？

String.Source: Wolves are fierce creatures. Can you fight?
String.Dest: 狼是很凶悍的动物。你能对付吗？

String.Source: So Larsdon is the beast, and the axe cursed his blood. He must die.
String.Dest: 所以劳斯登是只野兽，那斧头诅咒了他的血液。他必须死。

String.Source: So Larsdon is the beast, and the axe cursed his blood. He must die.
String.Dest: 所以劳斯登是只野兽，那斧头诅咒了他的血液。他必须死。

String.Source: So Larsdon is the beast, and the axe cursed his blood. He must die.
String.Dest: 所以劳斯登是只野兽，那斧头诅咒了他的血液。他必须死。

String.Source: That's terrible news. Maybe killing the messenger will make me feel better.
String.Dest: 这真是个可怕的信息。可能把来报信的那人杀了会让我好受点。

String.Source: By Lorkhan's eyes! A talking ghost wolf!
String.Dest: 洛克汗之眼啊！这有一只会说话的幽灵狼！

String.Source: So which story is the truth?
String.Dest: 那么哪个故事才是真相？

String.Source: So which story is the truth?
String.Dest: 那么哪个故事才是真相？

String.Source: So which story is the truth?
String.Dest: 那么哪个故事才是真相？

String.Source: So which story is the truth?
String.Dest: 那么哪个故事才是真相？

String.Source: The beast who cannot be slain.
String.Dest: 无法杀死的野兽。

String.Source: The beast who cannot be slain.
String.Dest: 无法杀死的野兽。

String.Source: The beast who cannot be slain.
String.Dest: 无法杀死的野兽。

String.Source: The beast who cannot be slain.
String.Dest: 无法杀死的野兽。

String.Source: How do I know you aren't another one Eldritch's tricks?
String.Dest: 我怎么知道你不是另一个艾卓曲的把戏？

String.Source: How do I know you aren't another one Eldritch's tricks?
String.Dest: 我怎么知道你不是另一个艾卓曲的把戏？

String.Source: What do you remember of your prior existence?
String.Dest: 你对你的过去还有一些什么样的记忆？

String.Source: What do you remember of your prior existence?
String.Dest: 你对你的过去还有一些什么样的记忆？

String.Source: Its master would like its new pet to sit and be a good boy.
String.Dest: 它的主人会喜欢上它这样乖巧听话的新宠物的。

String.Source: Its master would like its new pet to sit and be a good boy.
String.Dest: 它的主人会喜欢上它这样乖巧听话的新宠物的。

String.Source: I've seen stranger things. From whence have you come?
String.Dest: 我看到了诡异的事情。你是从哪里来的？

String.Source: I've seen stranger things. From whence have you come?
String.Dest: 我看到了诡异的事情。你是从哪里来的？

String.Source: I thank you for your help. Is there a way I can call upon you again?
String.Dest: 多谢你的帮助。有什么办法让我再次召唤你吗？

String.Source: I'm sorry, I didn't understand a word you just said.
String.Dest: 不好意思，你说的话我一个字都没听懂。

String.Source: I'm sorry, I didn't understand a word you just said.
String.Dest: 不好意思，你说的话我一个字都没听懂。

String.Source: I'm sorry, I didn't understand a word you just said.
String.Dest: 不好意思，你说的话我一个字都没听懂。

String.Source: Great. If the axe is fake, the whole ritual is a lie, just like my love life.
String.Dest: 太好了。要是这斧头是假的，那整个仪式都是场骗局，跟我的爱情一样假。

String.Source: Great. If the axe is fake, the whole ritual is a lie, just like my love life.
String.Dest: 太好了。要是这斧头是假的，那整个仪式都是场骗局，跟我的爱情一样假。

String.Source: Great. If the axe is fake, the whole ritual is a lie, just like my love life.
String.Dest: 太好了。要是这斧头是假的，那整个仪式都是场骗局，跟我的爱情一样假。

String.Source: A mudcrab with tentacle claws.
String.Dest: 有触手一样的爪子的泥蟹。

String.Source: A mudcrab with tentacle claws.
String.Dest: 有触手一样的爪子的泥蟹。

String.Source: A mudcrab with tentacle claws.
String.Dest: 有触手一样的爪子的泥蟹。

String.Source: A mudcrab with tentacle claws.
String.Dest: 有触手一样的爪子的泥蟹。

String.Source: If mortal blood will make the beast, why choose Larsdon?
String.Dest: 如果凡人之血会诞生野兽，为什么选劳斯登？

String.Source: If mortal blood will make the beast, why choose Larsdon?
String.Dest: 如果凡人之血会诞生野兽，为什么选劳斯登？

String.Source: How did the war-teacher use you?
String.Dest: 战争导师是怎么指使你的？

String.Source: How did the war-teacher use you?
String.Dest: 战争导师是怎么指使你的？

String.Source: Who was the war-teacher?
String.Dest: 那个战争导师是谁？

String.Source: Who was the war-teacher?
String.Dest: 那个战争导师是谁？

String.Source: Then we should hurry and warn Larsdon before the curse takes him.
String.Dest: 那我们得赶快去警告劳斯登 ，赶在他受到诅咒之前。

String.Source: Then we should hurry and warn Larsdon before the curse takes him.
String.Dest: 那我们得赶快去警告劳斯登 ，赶在他受到诅咒之前。

String.Source: Then we should hurry and warn Larsdon before the curse takes him.
String.Dest: 那我们得赶快去警告劳斯登 ，赶在他受到诅咒之前。

String.Source: Why can't you be like other talking animals and shut up?
String.Dest: 你能不能像别的会说话的动物一样把嘴闭上？

String.Source: It remembers building, but whose memories they are it does not know.
String.Dest: 还有些许的记忆，但是这些记忆到底来自于谁我也不知道了。

String.Source: From death itself. It does not remember much, save that it is ring bound, forced to serve a master and denied eternity.
String.Dest: 从死者自身来说，不需要记得太多。那只是种无尽的束缚，使他们被迫服从他们的主人并无法转世。

String.Source: If you plan to use it, wait until the dragon is near death to cast the spell. When a good portion of its blood, it has lost.
String.Dest: 如果你打算使用这个魔法的话，耐住性子，直到龙死去的前一刻再念出咒语。那时，它的血液已不再鲜活。

String.Source: But it is Ysgramor, and not the wolf, that he worshipped. The Kingsmoot was theft, and if you acknowledged it, you bent the knee to thieves.
String.Dest: 但他崇拜的是伊斯格拉谟，不是狼。如果你承认众王议会就是偷窃，那就代表你向匪徒们屈膝了。

String.Source: That would depend on what its current existence is. Is it a man tainted by the beast blood, or an animal freed from the man?
String.Dest: 这将取决于我当前的存在是什么。是一个被野兽之血玷污的男人，还是一只从人体内得以释放的动物？

String.Source: The strength of the king's blood is needed to survive the ritual. This is also why to save him, will come at the cost of one's life.
String.Dest: 国王之血的力量需要从仪式中幸存下来。这也是为什么需要以一个人的生命为代价来救他的原因。

String.Source: The blood is the poison. To save him, it must be transferred, blood for blood, with a spell.
String.Dest: 他的血液里充满了剧毒。为了救他，这些血液必须被替换掉，通过法术以血易血。

String.Source: The first story tells of Borgas consumed, and an axe made from his bone.
String.Dest: 第一个故事是关于鬼迷心窍的包嘎斯，以及一把由他骨头做的斧头。

String.Source: It will not do enough to warn him. One must remove the blood from his body.
String.Dest: 这还不足以引起他的警觉。得给他来点狠的。

String.Source: It apologizes to its master. It speaks in howls. It howls to warn.
String.Dest: 它对它的主人道歉。 它嗥叫着讲话。 它嗥叫来警告。

String.Source: A dragon's blood flows like any other. It can still be done. The problem is the amount of blood.
String.Dest: 一条龙的血流出来的时候，和其他生物的血一样，它也会干涸。问题是出血量略大啊。

String.Source: Fret not, for the answers to your questions sits before you.
String.Dest: 不公平，因为答案就在你面前坐着。

String.Source: Ah, but there is a second story. It tells another tale, of a man asked to fetch Borgas' remains.
String.Dest: 啊，但还有第二个故事。这是另一个传说，主旨是一个男人被要求寻找包嘎斯的残留物。

String.Source: Ah, but there is a second story. It tells another tale, of a man asked to fetch Borgas' remains.
String.Dest: 啊，但还有第二个故事。这是另一个传说，主旨是一个男人被要求寻找包嘎斯的残留物。

String.Source: A king, the ritual does not crown. A king, it devours.
String.Dest: 无冕之王，它却吞噬一切。

String.Source: When the ring is removed, the rage subsides, waters are stilled, and its mind returns, but its body is weak.
String.Dest: 当戒指被褪下之时，那狂躁不已的愤怒终于平息，潮水平静了下来，而它的神智也清醒了，但身体却变得虚弱不堪。

String.Source: A bone is missing. This man, he fears what his master will tell him if the corpse is incomplete.
String.Dest: 一块骨头丢了。这个男人害怕如果这具尸体不完整的话，他的主人会骂他。

String.Source: A bone is missing. This man, he fears what his master will tell him if the corpse is incomplete.
String.Dest: 一块骨头丢了。这个男人害怕如果这具尸体不完整的话，他的主人会骂他。

String.Source: The beast is not slain. It is born. A king, the ritual does not crown. A king, it devours.
String.Dest: 野兽不是被杀了，而是出生了。仪式不是加冕了一位国王，而是吞噬了一位国王。

String.Source: The wolf understands. But what if the sacrifice was not yours? Perhaps another dragon, one whose blood was as full as it is strong.
String.Dest: 狼很理解。但如果这牺牲不是你的呢？或许是另一头龙，另一头血液如同它的力量一般充盈的龙。

String.Source: No, the axe, forged from beast bone, and quenched in blood, creates a new monster.
String.Dest: 不，这把斧子，锻之以兽骨，淬之以鲜血，创造出一个新的怪物。

String.Source: And so, without another thought, he picks up another to put in its place. A cursed bone. The bone of a beast.
String.Dest: 然后，他毫不犹豫地拿起另一根骨头来作为替代。那被诅咒的骨头，那属于某头野兽的被诅咒的骨头。

String.Source: And so, without another thought, he picks up another to put in its place. A cursed bone. The bone of a beast.
String.Dest: 然后，他毫不犹豫地拿起另一根骨头来作为替代。那被诅咒的骨头，那属于某头野兽的被诅咒的骨头。

String.Source: This wolf is but a spirit. It can be slain, and it can be hailed. All the master needs to do is find the other tome.
String.Dest: 这狼不过是个灵魂，它可以被杀死，也可以被称颂。大师所需要做的只是找到其他的书。

String.Source: To dead ones the former master spoke, and spoke loudly. The ritual is not what it seems. It is certain death for all.
String.Dest: 上任大师告诉过这些现在已死的人，并且说的很大声。这个仪式不是它看起来的那个样子，它对所有人都意味着注定的死亡。

String.Source: Alas, it is weak. It runs in fear at the first sign of danger, and quivers at the sight of blood.
String.Dest: 啊，有人说它咆哮，但那只不过是谎言而已。事实上它一瞄到危险便撒腿就跑，一看到鲜血就浑身哆嗦。

String.Source: Silence is not its best trait. It prefers to howl, and scratch, but not in that order.
String.Dest: 沉默并不是它最好的品质。它更喜欢嚎叫，抓挠，不过不是像那样。

String.Source: Perhaps it was once a man, but it now through spirit lives, wearing the face of a wolf.
String.Dest: 也许他曾经是人，但如今唯有灵魂仍旧存在着，披着张狼的面具。

String.Source: Perhaps it was once a man, but it now through spirit lives, wearing the face of a wolf.
String.Dest: 也许他曾经是人，但如今唯有灵魂仍旧存在着，披着张狼的面具。

String.Source: Yes, perhaps he should be slain before he cannot. The king's blood is strong, as is the beast's poison.
String.Dest: 是的，也许该有人在他成为不死之身以前杀了他。国王之血很强大，于野兽来说是味致命的毒药。

String.Source: The war-teacher, he knew. The axe was not made of King's bone, but rather, the beast that consumed him.
String.Dest: 战争导师，他知道。斧子没能要了国王的命，但是更甚，野兽把他吞得一干二净。

String.Source: One of the books burned here was a man's confession, and another, written centuries later, warned of its consequences.
String.Dest: 其中一本书被埋藏在这里，内容则是某人的忏悔。而另一本完成于几个世纪之后的书就警示了世人关于此事的后果。

String.Source: It finds the second half of the request...redundant, but its best it will do, for its soul is bound to the ring, and the bearer it serves.
String.Dest: 看来那个请求的后半部分是……多余的，可最好还是能够完成，因为它的灵魂绑定在那戒指上，服从于它的持有者。

String.Source: The bone is vengeance, meant to slay the beast of the Wild Hunt. The immortal one that consumed him.
String.Dest: 那骨头是一个复仇之魂，意在杀死那荒野狩猎的野兽，那只把吃掉了的不死之身。

String.Source: Yes. Although it is not sure how. It remembers defying Hircine, and its soul to ring bound.
String.Dest: 是啊。虽然不知到底怎么回事。它还能记得挑战海尔辛的事，还有自己的灵魂被戒指所束缚。

String.Source: Perhaps it was once a man, but it now lives through its spirit, which wears the face of a wolf.
String.Dest: 或许它曾经是有个人样，但现在不过是个放纵着自己的灵魂，狼面兽心的野兽罢了。

String.Source: A master of blood. One who was given the beast blood at a young age, and became slave to its power.
String.Dest: 血之主。那些家伙在年幼时被给予了野兽之血，然后成了野兽之力的俘虏。

String.Source: One of the books burned here, was a man's confession, and another, written centuries later, warned of its consequences.
String.Dest: 在这堆被烧毁的书里面，有一本是一个人的自白书，而另一本，成书时间比第一本晚了几个世纪，警示了前一本中的后果。

String.Source: One of the books burned here, was a man's confession, and another, written centuries later, warned of its consequences.
String.Dest: 在这堆被烧毁的书里面，有一本是一个人的自白书，而另一本，成书时间比第一本晚了几个世纪，警示了前一本中的后果。

String.Source: No. The master's jaws should clamp at its throat and never let go. Or perhaps, like the vampire, drink its blood instead.
String.Dest: 不。大师的牙齿会紧紧地咬住它的喉咙并且永不放松。又或者，就像吸血鬼一样，以吸它的血来替代。

String.Source: There is a way to do so, and save his life. But one must trade blood for blood, with a spell.
String.Dest: 有一种方法可以做到那样，也可以救下他的命。但是那魔法奉行的就是等价交换的原则，以血来换血。

String.Source: But know this. If you are not of king's blood, you will not survive the transfer.
String.Dest: 但记住这点。如果你没有王者之血，你将死于这易血。

String.Source: But know this. If you are not of king's blood, you will not survive the transfer.
String.Dest: 但记住这点。如果你没有王者之血，你将死于这易血。

String.Source: But know this. If you are not of king's blood, you will not survive the transfer.
String.Dest: 但记住这点。如果你没有王者之血，你将死于这易血。

String.Source: But when the master bears the ring, it becomes a beastman once more, and loses its temperance.
String.Dest: 而一旦主人戴上那枚戒指，它就会再次变成兽人，失去它的理智。

String.Source: The master's companion has no fear, but she is fearful.
String.Dest: 主人的同伴无所畏惧，她却吓破了胆。

String.Source: It has no proof, but choice it had neither. A master it serves, from one to the next. Before it was him, now it is you.
String.Dest: 没有什么证据，却也没有其他选择的可能。它侍奉一个又一个主人，上一个是他，现在轮到你了。

String.Source: When the bone is quenched in mortal blood, it takes on a new form. Thus a beast is not slain. It is born.
String.Dest: 当兽骨被凡人之血淬炼之时，而是呈现出一个新的形式。因此，野兽不是被杀掉了。而是重获新生。

String.Source: But perhaps there is another way. Use the spell, trade blood for blood.
String.Dest: 但或许还有另一种方式。用上这魔法吧。以血易血。

String.Source: No, a beast so vicious it could not be slain, until the day the Axe of a Forgotten King is wielded by a forgotten son.
String.Dest: 不，如此凶猛的野兽是无法被杀死的，直到被遗忘国王的巨斧被那遗忘之子挥舞的那一天。

String.Source: The tome will exchange blood for blood. But know that whoever takes the beast form will not survive.
String.Dest: 底座上的书会订立血契，但是要知道任何承受野兽形态的人都不会幸存。

String.Source: Yes. There is another book. Find it, and I will heed your call.
String.Dest: 是的，还有另外一本书，找到它，我会留意到你的呼唤的。

String.Source: By Lorkhan's eyes! A talking ghost wolf!
String.Dest: 洛克汗之眼啊！这有一只会说话的幽灵狼！

String.Source: It apologizes for frightening you.
String.Dest: 它对吓到了你感到抱歉。

String.Source: Hm...you do not appear to have the ring. That leaves one other.
String.Dest: 额...你看起来好像没有那枚戒指。那一定在别人手里。

String.Source: Perhaps it was once a man, but it now through spirit lives, wearing the face of a wolf.
String.Dest: 也许他曾经是人，但如今唯有灵魂仍旧存在着，披着张狼的面具。
